I am afraid you are taking this personally again.=C2=A0 I expect why everyo=
ne isn't "jumping down my throat" is because I am not attacking anyone, or =
calling anyone names, like you seem to be trying to make them believe.=C2=
=A0 And I just don't understand your motive for that.=C2=A0 I am just sayin=
g what my experience shows, like they do too.

There are some things on whi=
ch I share your opinion: while some say the voices are from ghosts, you do =
not seem convinced of that.=C2=A0 I don't mean that comment personally: tha=
t's my opinion.=C2=A0 

And there are some things I do not share your opini=
on.=C2=A0 Again, not personal: that's my opinion.=C2=A0 

How is that talki=
ng down to anyone?=C2=A0 My wish for this group would be to stop accusing p=
eople of arrogance and debunking just because they don't always agree with =
you, and stay on the topic of EVP-ITC, and its processes, results, and tech=
nology.

=C2=A0

My EVP research has not yet produced =
anything I could claim as paranormal, which is why I have not posted any.=
=C2=A0 I also have not yet heard any evidence here or elsewhere which convi=
nced me that there was a paranormal element involved.=C2=A0 Hence my curren=
t difference of opinion. Yet I continue to listen.=C2=A0 How is that cynica=
l? 


Frank, if I am reading your statements correctly, you seem take littl=
e account of my opinions, and accuse me of things like twisting words and m=
aking you look like an idiot, though I have not.=C2=A0=C2=A0 How is that no=
t cynical?


'Cynics just disparage, and take little account of other opini=
ons.=C2=A0=C2=A0 They often come across as arrogant when their beliefs are =
challenged.=C2=A0 They change topics when challenged or asked to consider o=
bjective testing, and accuse and insult others.=C2=A0 "'

There are researchers, cynics, and believers.

Cynics just disp=
arage, and take little account of other opinions.=C2=A0=C2=A0 They often co=
me across as arrogant when their beliefs are challenged.=C2=A0 They change =
topics when challenged or asked to consider objective testing, and accuse a=
nd insult others.=C2=A0 


Researchers may or may not agree.=C2=A0 They are=
 willing to accept evidence for, and evidence against.=C2=A0 They are willi=
ng to change their opinion when the evidence supports it.=C2=A0 They are no=
t afraid to challenge statements, and are not afraid to have their own chal=
lenged.=C2=A0 They value testing.


Believers seem to be at the other end o=
f the spectrum as cynics.=C2=A0 They take little account of other opinions.=
 They often come across as arrogant when their beliefs are challenged.=C2=
=A0 They change topics when challenged or asked to consider objective testi=
ng, and accuse and insult others.=C2=A0 


So in fact, Believers and Cynics=
 are really the same, just with different beliefs.
